intro: Ascyrum amplexicaule, commonly known as the clasping ascyrum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and are often covered in fine hairs. The small, white or greenish flowers appear in umbels, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
